When all of the eigenvalues are strictly positive, whitening of a data point
, where the inverse square root can be taken element-wise.
class supports singular covariance matrices. When computing

, non-positive eigenvalues are ignored. Whitening is not well defined when the point to be whitened does not lie in the span of the columns of the covariance matrix. The convention taken here is to treat the inverse square root of non-positive eigenvalues as zeros.
A sequence (nominally a tuple) containing the eigenvalue and eigenvector arrays as computed by
Representation of a covariance provided via eigendecomposition
Prepare a symmetric positive definite covariance matrix
